name: Holiday Inn Express, Ramsgate - Minster

reviews.text: This chain is always my first choice for overnight stops but not stopped in one for a few years.
reviews.title: Good overnight stop

reviews.text: For a budget stop a bit more than Travelodge as you get breakfast. But this is about the cost of a reasonable seaside b&b.
reviews.title: Nice Art Deco Building

reviews.text: Room excellent standard as I expected and nothing not to like for the money.
reviews.title: Nice place but really a bit basic

reviews.text: Good location room as no noise not even from the corridor or showers of next door rooms.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unusual in this type of set up and I think hotel was nearly full.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay and a great dinner

reviews.text: The hotel 'is what it is' a standard featureless hotel aimed at the Business traveller, the room was clean and comfortable, some signs of general wear and tear. Ample parking on site, the staff were friendly and well presented, extras like internet access or movies had to be paid for, included was a complimentary breakfast, which was just that complimentary there was a selection of cereals and pastries but as far as cooked food there was just sausages, dried up scrambled egg and beans on offer, just as well it was complimentary although the price paid should of included at least a rasher of bacon or fried egg!!!!
reviews.title: It is what it is!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed overnight before trip to Belgium. Check-in at Reception very quick. Room very clean and well presented. Had to leave the next morning around 05:30 but was still offered breakfast - super service I must say. Have stayed at this hotel several times with no problems. Got a super room rate. Thanks once again
reviews.title: Short overnight stay

reviews.text: Booked this hotel as great deal. Impressed this also included breakfast. Room was clean and average size and was set up for us with the sofa bed already made up for our toddler. Room was cleaned to a high standard daily. Breakfast had a good range. With a car accessible to many different places. Staff were very pleasant. Only downside was poor mobile Internet signal in the room, although this wasn't a major issue for us.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped overnight in early January 2012. Very pleasant room with nice views, the cemetery in the foreground ensured it was quiet!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good continental breakfast

reviews.text: Room wasn't large but had everything needed and a good shower.
reviews.title: Back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would prefer to class this as an out of town Motorway Motel rather than a hotel. However, my stay was pleasant. The staff were very friendly, the room was large with a double bed and a bed settee. The shower room was clean and large. The room came with complimentary tea/coffee making facilities and reception gave me ample supplies when I asked for more. Unlike some of the budget hotel brands, they don't charge for breakfast or parking.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, good for 1 night, but out of town
Not the best hotel I've stayed at
reviews.text: The only downsides were that it was out of town on the edge of a dual carriageway, so it meant I had to drive to see anything of interest (not really a problem for a 1 night stay), and the buffet breakfast was a bit dried up and limited.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was OK, and I'd stay again if I couldn't find anything more centrally located for the same money.
reviews.title: Well eqipped budget hotel

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly. The food is horrible. My hotel room had a stale smell to it. Also if you leave a do not disturb sign on the door the maids leave a bag full of toilettree's outside your door which I thought was weird. Maybe that's normal in England.
reviews.title: Good Location, Helpful Staff

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights. On the basis of "you only get what you pay for", this hotel provided great value having booked well ahead to get discounted price. The bedroom had more facilities than has been experienced in any of the other large budget chains - hair dryer, soap, tissues, tea & coffee making facility, TV, internet access, etc. Breakfast also included in the price with a reasonable choice. Although close to a main road roundabout we were not disturbed by the noise from the traffic. Being dog friendly was also important to us (and our dog!). Will be quite happy to return here.
reviews.title: Smoking in rooms! in this day and age!!!!!! Awful!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel via booking.com as a very reasonable rate, the check in staff were very helpful and pleasant
reviews.title: overnight stay

reviews.text: The room was clean and fairly comfortable, the only problem was the shower curtain hung outside the tray and flooded the floor.
reviews.title: Holiday InnExpress Ramsgate

reviews.text: The area to the rooms was covered in muck due to the amount of contractors staying in hotel and walking around in dirty overalls and boots.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: The breakfast was absolutely disgusting it was over cooked and cold, would have been better going over the road to McDonalds
reviews.title: Highly Impressed

reviews.text: When we are next down that way we will pay the extra and stay in the Premier Inn
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Well Expressed.

aka: Holiday Inn Express, Ramsgate - Minster Hotel Ramsgate
description: East Kent's Award winning Hotel. Serving Thanet with 105 contemporary en-suite bedrooms, 3 conference suites and Bar and Restaurant. Located on the site of the Prospect Inn featured in many WWII films. The Place to "Meet, Eat and Sleep" in 2011.
